newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Irish bonds keep pace with firmer UK, Europe bonds.
newsitem.headline: Irish bonds keep pace with firmer UK, Europe bonds.

text.p: Irish government bonds edged higher in afternoon trade on Monday, buoyed by firm performances from the UK and European bond markets although dealers said volume was low.
"The Irish market has performed quite well as gilts and European markets pushed ahead," a dealer said.
"We are around 92 basis points over Germany in the 10-year area and 87 basis points below the UK, pretty much where we opened, so we have kept pace."
Attention this week will focus on Germany, where German October M3 data and the Ifo report are due.
The market will also keep a close eye on U.S. supply.

The U.S. Treasury is expected to auction $28 billion of three and six-month paper later in Monday's session, followed by $18.25 billion of two-year notes on Tuesday and $12.5 billion of five-year notes on Wednesday.

By 1542 GMT, the 6.5 percent Irish five-year benchmark bond was at 101.79 to yield 5.97 percent, up from 101.72 at Friday's close while the 10-year bond gained 15 pence to 108.80 to yield 6.62 percent.
